title: The Blue Buffs "owner."
body:
Was just in a match where my Ahri mid was performing very poorly against a Nidalee, and I came to gank 3 times before lvl 6 and twice had Nid dead to rights if Ahri had decided to... basically do anything at all.  No matter how many times I pinged she'd never actually help, and only once were her minions actually on her tower so that can't be her excuse for the other two times.

Because of this utter lack of an attempt to get back into the game, when she pinged "OMW" to the second blue I told her, "no, I'm taking this cause Skarner not only has decent mana problems but you're just going to give it up right now, Nidalee will take it from you, sorry."

She responds with "k" then walks over to the blue wall so she can burst it down, since Skarner doesn't really have any burst, so I smite it!  I literally told her I was taking it, so I have no idea what she was expecting.

At that point for about 5 mins she just followed me around the jungle trying to take every little bit of farm from me and when I tried to take advantage of her immaturity and bring her to a gank on top lane she just started taking all of our Jayce's farm while the two of us killed Hecarim.

I told her at that point that since it was only a team builder and I was just playing to try out the new Skarner skin, which is awesome btw, that if she was going to deliberately hinder the game for us I'd just afk and not waste my time on her.  So in response her duo Q partner Ezreal started to follow me around as well, so they were both taking all the jungle farm for no reason.

So I apologized to everyone in all chat and told them that Ahri and Ezreal were deliberately trying to ruin the game for me cause I took the blue buff, then quit the game.  Did I get reported?  Probably.  Was it warranted?  Yes, I admit that, but honestly I'd rather take a report then waste 30-40 mins of my time in a game where a duo Q was spending their time exclusively trying to ruin the whole thing for me cause I took the second blue buff from a feeding Ahri.

Moral of the story here guys, the BLUE BUFF DOESN'T BELONG TO THE MID LANER!  It's up to the jungler on who gets the blue and if he doesn't give to you, especially if you're losing your lane really hard, that doesn't mean you can throw a hissy fit and ruin the entire game.  To anyone who does this or think it's ok, you need to grow up and get over yourself.

just think if i taxed your lane and then died to a krug

Or who keeps better track of the timer :P

Mids truly need to stop thinking it's automatically theirs, because it's not, even if they're doing well. 
I personally put my faith in the jungler that if he no longer needs it, he will offer it to me. Otherwise I don't even care.

this is the big reason i dont play teambuilder anymore people are the most toxic in this mode than any other i found

The blue belongs for the team. The jungler is usually the person who gets to decide who gets it, but it's not like they can't be wrong. You were in the right for not giving Ahri blue (she would have just given it up anyway) but it's not the junglers either; if I'm playing Anivia or another mana hungry champ and you don't give me blue, then get mad at me for getting outpushed, then fuck you I'm gonna try to outsmite you.
As a mid main, I hate when I'm playing jungle and my mid lane thinks the blue is theirs. Personally I don't even take it late game without asking. Even if I'm doing very well for myself.

I almost wish buffs followed Smite's logic and need to be collected, rather than given to the killer (at least in the event of taking them from the jungle, not PVP-transfer). Perhaps have blue/red drop a small interactive shrine (like Thresh lantern). This solves petty laners from stealing it, but also removes some of the accidental camp taking when giving it. Maybe make it so that if smite scores the kill it takes the buff without summoning the shrine, for invasions.
Blue buffs belong to the one who needs it the most and performs well enough with it to not pass it to the other team.
I once had a Xerath try to trick me into smiting blue for mana. Might've worked if he wasn't raging over losing his lane, and RIGHT THERE!

The jungler decides who gets the buffs, but if my midlaner is doing alright I don't see any reason to not give him blue even if I am playing Fiddlesticks or Vi jungle who can really make use of it. If I see our midlaner flaming though (don't care who and don't care for what reason) I won't give him the blue.

Jungler owns it. Your Ahri was horrible. When I'm mid I always try to manage my mana so I don't expect blue. Unless I'm really struggling for mana I actively feel bad for taking it when it's offered.

It really depends on the jungler though. If my mid (or maybe support) is doing well enough then I will try to give blues away as soon as I can but I can't think of any jungler aside from Rek'Sai and Lee Sin that wouldn't need the second blue. If you expect ganks you should expect your jungler to have the first several blues, not even just the second one and certainly not just the first one.

I don't play much mid lane but I remember one time when I was playing Swain and I was having a horrible game and the jungler offered me blue buff and I just told him to take it after all I was doing so badly and I was afraid I would just give it to the enemy which would just make things worse and while yes blue buff is really good on swain... it isn't of much use if you are dead and the enemy has it...

Well I did take it later on in the game when I was doing better and laning phase had ended though

Since I play every role, most of the time I just invade when the enemy jungle's blue is up and he's most likely taking it. Usually it's a free kill and blue buff or it's just a free blue. But if I'm not playing someone who would be good at doing that and getting out, I will ask my jungle for blues and if he says no because he still needs it then, that's just the way it is.
I don't need your filthy blue buff. I need a good gank or at least keeping vision up and I'll get a blue from the other dude. ^_^
I agree. I wouldn't give up any buffs to a feeder even if they request it. I only time I approve if I see a team member do well even if they're behind in cs, but not feeding.

Technically it belongs to nobody:

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Buff

On a sidenote I wouldn't give any sort of buffs to any laner that's severly behind the whole game. I won't risk you being an automatic Red/Blue buff delivery service for the enemy team just in the hopes you can catch up.

Jungle buffs are another resource for the team to distribute. There's a lot to consider, including champ select, individual performance, how likely you can steal their buffs, and if your mid is being an asshole.

If I'm riven, and my team is feeding/playing stupid ( not focusing objectives, chasing for kills into enemy jungle, being toxic,) blue buff is no longer junglers or mid laners. It's mine. Try to stop me from taking it. I can burst it down in two seconds :) 
( I'll try to not do this but there's games where Id rather not have a zed or katarina with extra 10% CDR and free gold from my teammates feeding)

Blue buff belongs to the person who kills it. Its that simple. Typically its the jungler because they can move around freely. Its up to the jungler to typically give it away since most mid champs can't solo a blue early on. Later on a mid laner can take it no problem alone. Thats why i say it belongs to who ever kills it.
